reviewDescription: I couldn't justify spending the amount of money on the laptop I really wanted, and opted for this because it's good for the price. Initially everything was fine. Less than 24 hours later, the touchpad became unresponsive. I noticed shortly after startup the icon indicating the touchpad was off would pop up. I could only get a cursor by using a mouse in the usb.TL/DRGo to drivers.softpedia.com and search for Acer Aspire ES1-111M Elantech Touchpad Driver 13.6.3.1 for Windows 10 64-bitIf there's a newer one, I didn't bother, this resolved the issue as soon as I setup the driver and rebooted the laptop. The driver that the laptop uses by default is an old 2006 Microsoft driver which can't handle the newer touchpads.Things that did not work (aka maybe don't waste your time):1. Turning the touchpad back on (also this laptop had the touchpad on f10, not f6 or f7 like other models)2. Checking updates (even the optional ones)3. Uninstalling the driver and rebooting to force it into reinstalling uncorrupted4. Entering BIOS and changing touchpad to PS/2Save yourself the time and hassle, just install a better touchpad driver as soon as you're done with initial setup.Other than that, it's a good laptop. I do minimal gaming (I don't play AAA titles on pc but indie games are great), a bit of programming, some spreadsheet work, and a little graphic design work. This does what I need sufficiently. 4 stars only because of the issue with the touchpad driver, which seems to be very common if you read reviews around online.Update: I've knocked this down to 3 stars. I shut down the laptop last night, and after coming home from work today, I turned it on and it won't register my docking station anymore. I thought maybe an issue with my dock, but I did every troubleshooting step I could, and went to Google. When I was there, I noticed the touchpad was acting up. It wasn't allowing me to scroll. I checked the driver, and to my horror, it had reverted back to the outdated 2006 Microsoft driver. I looked at the rest of my drivers (as I had done the previous day to make sure nothing else was outdated) and EVERY DRIVER was a 2006 Microsoft driver, when just yesterday the oldest I had found was from last year. At this point I'm thinking about returning the laptop. I'm in the process of doing a system restore to what I had that worked, and if this still won't correct it, I'm sending it back. I have had this laptop for 3 days at this point, and two of those days were spent trying to fix it.Update: Leaving it at 2 stars. The restore slightly worked, all my drivers were back to normal EXCEPT the touchpad driver was still outdated from 2006, only now it won't let me install a newer driver. I reset the entire computer to see if that would help... Same, but at least now the other drivers aren't magically reversing to outdated garbage. I usually have my laptop hooked to a docking station so it's not the end of the world that I can't use the touchpad, but having to carry a mouse with me if I do want to take the laptop even into the other room is a nuisance.Unacceptable that after 4 days the touchpad became useless.

First off, I scrutinized this purchase to make sure it fit my needs moving forward. Acer Nitro had done great in the past for me. The excellent lifetime given by my previous Nitro 5, i5 Gtx1060  from 2018. Brought me back with established brand confidence.Then it hurt my feelings with deceptive system write ups, misleading access port specs, ect...The short version.This is a whole lot of all the right components forced to live with each other against their will. This laptop is an uncooperative disappointment.All the gripes:I picked this model specifically for its Thunderbolt 4 USB C Display Adapter Port and was thrilled about the RTX3060 GPU.It took 20 hours of setup (WTF seriously) to find out that besides all the issues that would have made it a defective return anyhow, the Display Port is hard wired to the Intel HD on-board graphics processor. It is built to fail on that point.This system has issues built into it in ways that boggle your bogs. The screen had 7 to 8 light discoloration areas around the edges like it had been beaten on from the inside. The new power cord design is something I hope they have fixed in 2023. My experience was it caused power failures when moved while plugged in.  Sudden total power failures, it was like to a blackout.Speaking of feedback, the audio on board sends back slight popping sounds.  Digital distortions from all operations and outputs was intermittent; it does seem consistent as reported by other owners of this model. Some speculation whether this is a new WinOS build issue.If you are a VR user just looking to occasionally link to a laptop, find another. It is possible but the performance of the  RTX3060 in this systems build is surprisingly dismal. At midrange settings, no ray tracing, CP2077 (Cyberpunk 2077) was not able to hold 15 FPS for any interaction beyond the menu screen. The RTX GPU and the CPU share a studio apt with inadequate airflow. It heats up fast and "The GPU Little Dual Fans that Could" can't . Why they even let this build go into manufacture is beyond me. This machine cannot keep baseline operating temperature while watching a Movie. This is actually the first time in 13 years of having a laptop as a critical tool of my trade that I even noticed they had any fans. I always just gave them proper ventilation. You will notice these fans thiugh, when the 95 to 110 degree air starts blasting from all possible routes. This is the GPU warning you that an " Emergency Safety Shutdown" is about to occur because you are playing Fortnite or whatever. This was the only helpful unintended feature. I found I had about 15 to 20 seconds to save my game or work. By the time I figured out that workflow hack, I finally admitted to myself that I had been naive and was being stubborn trying to create work arounds and validate the value of my purchase.If you are the kind of person who enjoys taking badly designed hardware platforms and tinkering with them you found a deal here..Cyberware PC, ASUS, NITRO have done well by me for the 3 previous workstations I have built on their bare bones. My 2018 Nitro 5 survived, falls, collisions and was even stepped on (In my bag) and made a cracking noise that brought so many simultaneous gasps in a room full of technicians that you could feel the air leaving the room.So please don't let this lengthy review of this one product turn you away from the brand. It has been solid so far.Goodbye 2018 Nitro 5 you were a adequate tool and a  nobel machine.R.I.P.  "MiniPrime"2018-2023 Death by Winter Storm  😭 Like tears in Rain,,I found it next an open window after a storm, in a puddle.Waaaah!If you read this whole thing, thanks I guess. I wish you the best in all that you give your best to.

reviewTitle: 2 repairs needed since purchased 11 months ago...
reviewDescription: If you're looking for a affordable gaming laptop, I'm sure this model came up. I mean, it looks cool, pricing appears reasonable, and there's room for upgrades, so what's not to like right? Well if only it was that simple.First the pros.1. Pricing.2. Ports (3 usb-a ports + 1 usb-c port + 1 hdmi port + ethernet port) ... yup, it's chunky!3. Wifi 64. upgradeable RAM5. Additional StorageFor me, I loved the fact that I could upgrade the RAM along with the SSD's and HDD. So I did just that. I swapped out the old RAM for 2 Crucial 16GB DDR4, boosting my RAM to 32GB. Not too shabby. Then, I added an additional 256GB M.2 PCle SSD and a 1TB SATA SSD making it even more chunkier.Parts List below (purchased through Newegg: Total cost $300.00):-Crucial 32GB (2 x 16GB) DDR4 2666MHz DRAM (Notebook Memory) CL19 1.2V DR SODIMM (260-pin) CT2K16G4SFD8266-Silicon Power 256GB NVMe M.2 2280 PCIe Gen3 x4 TLC SSD (SP256GBP34A60M28)-WD Blue 3D NAND 1TB Internal SSD - SATA III 6Gb/s 2.5"/7mm Solid State Drive - WDS100T2B0ASo you would think it would be running amazingly well with all of this under the hood. At first, yes, but I noticed after a while that it would freeze up every now and then. Meaning the screen would freeze but would then go back to normal. I never took it anywhere so it stayed in one location on my work desk and stayed running into about 9 months of its purchased life (June 2022). Then it just died. No power. Nothing. Tried all the reset tricks but nope. Nada. So I sucked in my pride and went crying to ACER directly who shushed me and told me they would make it all better. They mentioned it was a faulty motherboard which they replaced since it was under warranty. No harm no foul. However....I've only had it for 9 months!Now here we are...2 months after I received it back from ACER and now I got the notorious black screen of death. Yup. It finally happened. Oh I've tried everything. Even turning it off and on again. But no, I must suck up my pride once again and go crying to mommy ACER to fix this yet again. And you know what they said? Of course little Timmy! Ship it to us free of charge since it's still under warranty. I mean, I'm impressed with the warranty to be honest. But they're trying to distract me from the fact that it's been 11 months since I bought this thing and have had to turn it in for repairs TWICE!!! Yeah the customer service is great, yeah the warranty is great, but c'mon!!! Oh, that brings me to my cons list:Cons (The bads, the uglies, the face palm moments)-It's loud (like standing on the tarmac loud)-Heats up fast (The cooling system isn't that great. I would recommend getting an external cooling pad)-It's Big (I call it my BBC...big black computer. errr...what were you thinking I meant?)-the power cord in the back requires a double push-in to ensure it connects (there are so many forums discussing this it's not even funny)-Requires a ton of power to run this thing. So yeah, the power brick is literally a brick.-And just because I'm picky, unfortunately you're stuck with the black & red ensemble. The glowy red color does not change. Either red or no red. That's it.So all-in-all, for under $1k bucks, you can have an okay laptop with about 1.5TB of Storage and 512gb of ram. It's loud and hot, might shut off sometimes and never come on, but long as you get the extended warranty then you've got nothing to worry about. So make SURE you get the EXTENDED warranty if you do buy it. Trust me, it pays for itself and you'll be using it sooner than you think. But if you want to save yourself a headache and have the extra $$ to burn, then you can definitely do better than this machine. Avoid if possible, but if it can't be helped then at least get the warranty. You've been warned my friend.

I've delayed this review for so long because I wanted to try to rule out every other possibility beforehand. I can't fathom what else it could be but the computer at this point.Ever since I got this computer for when I travel, it's had issues. My first week consisted of reinstalling the OS 3+ times just to fix those issues (by this point I don't even remember what those original issues were). Then, ever since then, I know I've had the issue of USB ports.The USB ports will randomly lock out inputs. My microphone will randomly cut me off often, making calls very annoying. My controller will lock up my inputs randomly and for random lengths of time, making some gaming sessions impossible. I've thoroughly checked for viruses. Nothing. I've replaced my controller and the cords for both the controller and the microphone. Nothing. Everything works perfectly on other devices, then doesn't work on this one.I've since reinstalled the OS again, going back to Windows 10 instead of 11, while also completely wiping and reformatting the hard drive this time around to get an absolutely clean slate. Seemed good for a while, but no longer. Same USB issues. Also, Python's multiprocessing package fails to multiprocess on this machine correctly, despite the same exact code working perfectly on other machines with the same OS, same IDE, and same code. At this point, I'm convinced there's just underlying issues that's affecting all of these.I can't stand it anymore. I can't keep upping my IT skills until I can build a laptop by hand. A computer repair place couldn't even correctly diagnose my issues. I'm tired of this, grandpa. I don't want to do this anymore. I'm selling this soon and finding a replacement.

reviewTitle: Can't use PIN for login without wifi
reviewDescription: I set up a pin for my laptop when I bought it. Was using it and logging in just fine for the first week. And then took the laptop somewhere else where I wouldn't be at home or by wi-fi.I didn't realize that when you log in with your PIN it needs wi-fi to let you log in. I found this out the hard way once I was away from the wi-fi.You will get an error saying "Something and went wrong and your PIN is not available, click here to set up a new pin." When you go to set up a new PIN it tells you you need Wi-Fi to do so.  I wasn't at a place where I had access to Wi-Fi and intended to do work for the day at a location away from home. If I had known you need Wi-Fi in order to use a pin I never would have set one up and it was not apparent that this was the case when I set up a pin. I'm going to try and see if I can remove the necessity to have a pin but then I worry about the security so I'll probably have to get a thumbprint login for the USB or something. If I can't figure out another solution I will be returning the laptop. I have another Windows 11 laptop that does not require Wi-Fi to do a pin login so it seems that if something specific to this computer. I think it's quite ridiculous to not have a system or you could log into a computer without wi-fi. But I mostly annoyed because there was no warning that this was the case when I set up the pin. Or if there was they did not make it obvious.Rest for speed, it does okay but it crashed when I was doing render work for video editing within the first week and what I was doing was not very intense. It also is not substantially faster than my basic laptop that has no fancy video card before rendering.It was a reasonable deal money wise but I'm not as impressed as I hoped to be. And then the pin thing happened and I was just very annoyed.

Most annoying is that the keys are black and requires light to see the keys.  The keys do light up so they can be seen, but the backlight goes out after 30 seconds of no activity.  The user then has to press any key to get the backlight back on, which then enters that key on whatever you are working on.  If a backlight is required to see the keys, then you would think they would make the keys a more visible color than black.  Also, and this is really stupid, the keyboard goes black every 30 sec. of no use so it can qualify for some "Eco" designation.  Really, how much electricity is saved by a laptop keyboard going black every 30 sec.?  There is no way to change this 30 sec. interval. Stupid!Also, for some weird reason, to adjust volume, you have to press the "Fn" key and then the up or down arrows instead of dedicated keys.  Stupid!  Also, the layout of the keyboard is different from other laptops. So if you're using 2 computers, you have to place your hands in different positions. Stupid!The screen image is not very sharp.  Again, 2 hands needed to change the screen brightness instead of dedicated  keys, like most computers.  The "F" keys for volume and brightness do not work. Stupid!I would have returned this laptop, but I had it open and was setting it up when I realized this stupid design.  I won't buy an Acer again.

I had this for almost 2 years. Since day one is overwhealmingly not do the job for most some of the games. Like for the older games it would work fine but for the newer games it's just too slow. Honestly specially nowadays I am pretty sure you can find another options with better prices. Also the storage is just way too small and getting it upgraded is just a hustle.

This laptop makes a strange sound before fans kick on, runs 90c gaming and has a wobbly screen. It's brand new and the screen moves when I type, very annoying...Update: so the noise seems to be coil whine from what others have told me and it does run hot but only if you're maxing the games out, nothing a cooling pad can't fix. The wobble is annoying but I've heard it's normal, I think it's luck of the draw for that.My question is could I possibly tighten the hinge? It's not bad yet but with heavy use I could see it degrading over time.Update: hinge is already getting worse, making a clicking noise now. Frustrating thing when the laptop is now $700 vs the $800 I paid.

As someone who knows his way around computers after building several, knowing the market inside and out for prices on each components for just about anything. Seeing this made me gasp thinking it was a good deal when it was on sale for 850 US. i was so wrong. A 3050 with a miserable 10300h at 8gb at 2933 was a horrible combination. it is hard to just play simple high giving fps games like fornite, pubg, rocket league and many more. the only game i would cap out at 144 is rocket league and even then it would flicker every now and then to 90 or so. but other games at LOW texters no shadows whatever it may be, bottom of the barrel low barley gives you 60 and half the time your playing at 40fps. this is a honest review and i should have spent the extra hundred on something like a tuf laptop with a 17inch and better specs. this is not the computer for any real gaming. also when you receive the computer at "256gb" you realistically only get 180 because windows takes about 70-80 gigs just downloading. the drivers for this gpu is horrible at the moment and is bottlenecked by the absolute worst cpu i have ever used. every game is full load on gpu while the cpu cant push anything and dont think about overclocking because this computers psu wont allow it because its so bare minimum with the voltage that you cant touch anything about it besides upgrading the ram. dont go with this laptop is is HORRIBLE.

reviewTitle: Died after 18 months - past 1 year warranty
reviewDescription: Laptop worked fine for what I needed it for. Had a little bit of power, nothing special, but worked. Turned it on, booted to windows - black screen. Rebooted by holding power, nothing. Keyboard lights up, fans spin for 3 seconds and then shut off. Several sites say ways to reset but nothing works. It's a brick, no warranty. Do not recommend. I've had much cheaper laptops that lasted many years and simply upgrade drives/memory and keep trucking. Steer clear

reviewTitle: Wonderful gaming pc for the price
reviewDescription: Bought this laptop solely for playing vr and other games lots of people have shot it down for idk why sure it's not a high end laptop and if that's what your looking for move on but rather it's a solid choice for the price starts take seconds, loading into vr is seamless and runs vr games vr well! Again this is not a high end computer and should be expected to have some prefromene issues but still I am very impressed by the quality of this pc for the price

I'm an architecture student and I bought this laptop as I needed an affordable but powerful laptop to run some of the architectural software (Revit, Inventor, etc) while on the go. The dedicated 3050 comes in handy when rendering finished models and the CPU is beefy enough to handle all the processing requirements these programs take.While the i5 is great for my own needs I would recommend going with the i7 if you can afford the extra costs. I haven't found a laptop yet that can beat the performance this offers at this price.However here are some drawbacks and considerations.The screen quality is great but the backlight shows slightly and the color seems a bit off compared to when I link the screen to another monitor. Maybe that's a user error, but its a noticeable difference from when I look at the same image on another screenTerrible battery life. Make sure you always have a charging cord handy and don't expect it to last the entirety of a long flight. The battery last around 4 hours with light usage. 3 hours if I'm rendering or designing. If power-saving mode is enabled you can extend this time frame at the cost of performance.Low Storage and mediocre ram. Luckily these issues can be mitigated. Additional storage slots for SSD and HHD are available to increase storage capacity. The RAM is acceptable for what I need, however, if you plan on rendering large projects or want to play some AAA games you'll want to upgrade these features.I'm very happy with my purchase.

Let me start with my job turned me on to using high powered laptop’s plugged into docking stations for productivity. This is awesome because you can take your projects with you. I use the Nitro for video editing (4k 60fps) with Adobe Premiere Pro for youtube content. This thing remders 30 min 4k vids in LESS THAN 25 minutes. My old pc took an hour and would fail at times.It runs three dell 32in monitors no problem. I suspect it will run most games spectacularly. Though you may have to adjust frame rate. The picture quality is awesomeProsPrice pointThis thing is FAST!Graphics are on par with higher 4 digit cost laptopsPicture qualityProcessing powerFast boot upGreat for video editing and moderate gamingThe keyboard is solid and big for a laptop which is a plus.ConsWindows 11Only 512gb storageIts a heavier laptopFans are loudWindows 11The battery life is… what you’d expect.Looking at maybe 1-2 hours if you’re heavy in use and maybe 3-4 woth light use and power saving settings.Lets look at the truth and that is you’re not gonna be gaming on batt power and this thing shines hooked into bigger multiple monitors. The laptop lets you carry to a buddy’s or coffee shop to continue the fun.Did I mention windows 11?Keyboard light doesn’t stay lit too long, even on power and can’t find a setting for it.

reviewTitle: After 32gb ram upgrade plays battlefield 2042 max settings.
reviewDescription: The 8gb ram will not play current video games on high or low settings aside from counterstrike 2 / valorant. Battlefield 2042 lowest settings is unplayable choppy and freezes.After 32gb ram upgrade it plays battlefield 2042 on max settings perfectly and the best notebook gaming machine I've ever had.It needs the upgraded ram to function as a gaming high-end PC.CORSAIR Vengeance SODIMM DDR5 RAM 32GB (2x16GB) 5200MHz CL44 Intel XMP iCUE Compatible Computer Memory - Black (CMSX32GX5M2A5200C44)

reviewTitle: Great display and does everything you'd a Gaming laptop to do.
reviewDescription: I've had one for over a month with heavy use and its been great. It runs most game very smoothly at relatively high graphics. Th only downsides is that the fan can get loud and the battery life off the charger is bad. but even those aren't deal breakers especially when you can manually turn down the fan speed in the settings.

I bought this laptop to game on World of Tanks and with standard server and all the graphics turned on high in the game settings it runs about 150fps like it’s nothing. I keep mine plugged in all the time so I’m not too worried about the short battery life. Overall great purchase laptop looks great with good performance and I’m happy with it.

reviewTitle: It's a pretty great gaming machine!
reviewDescription: This particular laptop cost around $700 total when I bought it. I use it mostly for gaming, and it's been fantastic at that; I have some of the newest games (Like Baldur's Gate 3) run on max settings, and this laptop handles it like a champ! The glowing keys are extremely helpful when playing, as the neuropathy in my fingers makes playing by touch impossible. I will say, I thought this was the model that had the multicolor/programmable key highlights. It's not, this one is just red. Still neat, though!Only thing I'd change is I wish I'd have sprung for the 1TB version (or more, if they make it). Two of my games were 150GB each, so the memory filled up almost instantly. I think you can expand the hard drive, so I'm going to try that.
No issues and runs smoothly
Para juegos y refrigeración 10/10

I am not a gamer. I bought this for fixing my car. And boy this thing is fast!!!I’m not “into” computers, but for me it is super fast and works very well. It runs GM Software and HP Tuners like a champ.

Ya llevo con esta laptop casi un año y estas son mis impresiones:1. Lo que más me gustó es la capacidad de expansión: ahora tiene 32 GB de RAM (crucial 3200MHz), dos discos NVMe (256GB, y 1 TB) y uno SATA de 1 TB.2. El rendimiento para los juegos es aceptable: Halo Infinite corre a unos 90 FPS a 1080p y calidad media-baja de configuración. Otros juegos menos exigentes corren por encima de los 100 FPS.3. Hablando de la pantalla, la tasa de refresco es alta, no es tan cómoda frente a la luz directa (el brillo no es muy alto) y la representación de colores no es la mejor. No lo recomendaría para edición de video o fotografía, a menos que se contara con un monitor secundario de alta calidad.4. Para desarrollo de software es un gran equipo, el procesador, aunque ya de dos generaciones atrás, responde bien. Windows inicia inmediatamente y funciona bien para virtualización.5. La batería dura máximo 3 horas y media.6. El puerto USB C no tiene capacidades de carga de la laptop o de salida de video. Sería ideal que un tuviera un lector de tarjetas integrado.7. No tiene el switch MUX (tampoco es de esperar en el rango de precios).8. El teclado se siente bien, el touchpad después del primer mes empezó a mostrar un brillo como si tuviera años de uso, sin embargo, mantiene su funcionamiento normal.9. No es un computador muy vistoso y la calidad de los plásticos no es la mejor. Más pesado que un equipo no orientado a juegos pero sigue siendo transportable.10. La cámara y el micrófono son aceptables para videollamadas. Creo que los streamers preferirán conectar mejores dispositivos.Conclusión: revisar el precio y comparar. Si hay equipos con i5 o i7 de 12° generación o con RTX 3060, a un precio similar, sería mejor ir por esas opciones. Si el presupuesto es muy ajustado o está unos 200 dólares por debajo de la competencia, el Nitro 5 vale la pena.
Really enjoy having a gaming laptop for working out of town. It plays all the games I play and even some of the modded games very well.

Good laptop, this i5 10300 H and RTX 3050 is a great combination add a extra stick of ram make sure it’s @2933 and you should be okay. I would suggest just buying a duel channel kit of Corsair vengeance @ 2933 just to make sure the ram dimms work together probably. You can always add more storage later as Acer acutely advertises right on the laptop itself you can basically open it and add more at any time you see fit. For games like WoW open world 89-144 fps out questing. PvP epic or random around a average in the 90s fps with medium/high settings can handle being upscaled in game to 1440p with a small performance hit. But is great at 1080p seeing it’s a smaller screen resolution @ 1080p looks amazing. color is a tad lack luster but not a dealbreaker by any means at this price point does well with fallout series and other games as well. I honestly did not expect this to perform as well as it does. Honestly I think it’s handles games just as well as a gtx 1070 or in at or right under 1660ti desktop version. The 4GB v ram is not going to be able to handle ultra setting in most newer games. but with the smaller screen turning down certain settings are going to get you great performance With almost no visual quality loss. I would take higher refresh rate over higher resolution any day certain games you may not be able to achieve the 144hz but anything over 60 is going to stay buttery smooth. You will have one extra nvme ssd slot under the one in use I do believe that can handle up to a 2TB drive and a 2.5 sata drive slot as well. I Iiked it so much my girlfriend wanted a laptop and I couldn’t justify buying anything less even though she only plays sims 4. I can’t bring myself to buy anything in the 600 to 700$ range that only runs on integrated graphics it’s just not worth the money.

reviewTitle: So far so good with tips.
reviewDescription: I’ve only had this product for a day and about to take it on a trip, I’ll update if anything goes wrong but here it goes.1. Saw a lot of reviews about the laptop box arriving in a way larger box with a piece of paper used as “stuffing” this is correct… the laptop was shaking all around and I was nervous however the laptop box itself was very well packaged but Amazon could have done a lot more, easy way would just be use some bubble rap or even a lot more of the paper used to secure it.2. Opened everything up and I went to turn it on and nothing …. Kinda made me nervous but I plugged it in and it fired right up, after going through the whole setup and landing at the desktop I could see that the battery was at 80%. I think they enable it so you have to plug it in the first time you use it since it connects to the internet and does updates so that makes sense.3.  Right after going through the long tedious setup process the very first thing I did was go to settings and search for “reset”, from there you tell it to download a new copy of windows and let it do its thing. That way it gets rid of Norton and all the bloatware installed and you get a fresh vanilla copy of windows.4. Got everything back up and even installed a few games and so far everything has been great, no issues with screen, keyboard or anything else.5.  The picture of the laptop looks kinda goofy and I didn’t want this weird computer but for the price I said let’s try it. It looks very professional and it’s actually a great design In person, very sleek and everything is in the perfect spot including the charging port in the back.

reviewTitle: Una ch  1  n  g  0  n  e  r  1  a
reviewDescription: Por el precio q la agarre ,la verdad si vale la pena... Mucho mejor q la Lenovo idealpad oseria q ya estaba viejita,,, Quiensabe pero la verdad esta si esta buenala agarre por 500 y algo

reviewTitle: Amazing screen quality and performance at its price, but loud fans and poor speakers
reviewDescription: The screen was sufficiently bright and could run games pretty well, but the fans were pretty loud and the speakers were kinda meh quality. The build quality of the laptop itself was very impressive, very rugged and durable, and the hinges seem like they would last at least 6-7 years.I found that you could lower the fan sound a little by setting the Power profile of your computer to Balanced, and helping it even further along by setting the display to 60 Hz, but it might require you to use Vertical Sync/VSYNC in some games.  I was able to run Starfield at 100+ FPS on Low, but the fans were blaring at me the entire time. The fact that it also comes with SATA drive support is also very impressive, because most laptops have completely abandoned SATA support for NVME to save space and for slightly better thermal performance. This computer also has 2 fans for improved thermals (weird fact, I know, but some laptops only have 1), but they also generate twice the noise.Aside from that, this is a very solid entry-level gaming laptop and will be able to run modern games at low-medium settings for at least a few years.
Me.gusto

reviewTitle: For the price, this thing rules. However, upgrades may be required.
reviewDescription: There are plenty of reviews already, so I will be brief. I got this thing over a year ago now and have used it fairly extensively. For the price I paid, it can do some serious gaming. Primarily when I got it I was looking for a high(ish) CPU clock speed, a dedicated graphics card, and enough USB ports to support a second monitor/mouse/external HDD.I will note that one thing about this laptop is that it has two major limiting factors. The SDD that comes with it is great for the OS, but modern games and having a bulk of files made it essentially required that I add on additional storage. My solution happened to be an external HDD, but it has space for additional internal drives.I also had problems with capping out the RAM. 8 GB is not enough for serious gaming with a modern web browser opening. I was experiencing some choppiness. I did just upgrade to 16 GB and it is running nice and smooth. If you plan on using it for a main gaming computer, consider replacing the RAM with something more appropriate.For the price, it really is hard to complain. Even with the cost of my upgrades to it, the total cost pales in comparison to the utility. If you are looking for a gaming laptop for under 1k, this is a worthy consideration imho.
Great quality  nice graphics  good battery life value for your money

reviewTitle: A lot of power for a budget like this.
reviewDescription: I was looking for a new laptop and didn’t want to spend a fortune, since I already have my desktop. I wanted to be able to do other things PLUS gaming if I was somewhere else in the house other than my office. Definitely worth the money. Acer really made a legend with this one.
This laptop is crazy powerful and fast for the price point. Great battery life, crystal clear graphics and great built in features.

Cumplió la mayoría de mis expectativas, la uso para la universidad, para editar video, para jugar y rinde de maravilla.Refrigeración 10/10, buenas temperaturas, incluye su software para elegir el modo de los ventiladores.La batería me ha llegado a durar 3 horas con ahorro de energía, bajo brillo y haciendo tareas sencillas.La cámara se ve lo suficientemente bien, no es la gran cosa pero tampoco necesito que sea un punto fuerte.Micrófono combinado con la reducción de ruido por IA se escucha muy bien para reuniones.Teclado muy bueno, suficiente recorrido y buen tacto, la retroiluminacion funciona bien con diferente intensidad, solo es rojo pero funciona.El i5-12500h, va de maravilla, nunca he logrado usarlo al 100%, no importa cuántas cosas este haciendo multitarea. Es una maravilla.La 3050ti, es una gráfica de la gen pasada pero rinde lo suficiente, en juegos AAA nuevos si va a 100% pero siempre arriba de 60fps en especial con tecnologías como dlss. Su límite creo que son los 4gb de vram.Recomiendo mucho la versión con 16gb ram, hoy en día son una necesidad.Los puertos son muy variados y son todo lo que necesito, varios USB 3.2, USB-c, HDMI 2.1, Puerto Ethernet, jack de auriculares.Los únicos contras que le ví son:1. El trackpad no es tan fluido, se te traba el dedo, he usado mejores en computadoras más baratas, pero en lo personal siempre la uso con un mouse aparte y casi nunca uso el trackpad pero cuando salgo y no llevo mouse si se nota que es un punto débil.2. El brillo de la pantalla, me parece poco. Obvio no es una computadora para exteriores, pero incluso en interiores, a veces siento necesitar más brillo. Fuera de eso la pantalla se ve muy bien.
Máquina muy buena cumple con todas las especificaciones y expectativas

reviewTitle: Best laptop for your money, if memory ain't an issue...
reviewDescription: Basically, the best budget computer. Yeah, including Desktops.You're telling me I can buy a gaming computer that outperforms AND replaces Xbox, can be used on the go, and only costs 800$?? That's amazing. Gaming laptops have never been more affordable, and powerful, all at once. Half the price of your standard gaming laptops, without the assembly of a gaming desktop.Enough gushing, though. It's not perfect. At this price, you can play generally any of the standard games with only minor problems. I played Halo Infinite and Modern Warfare well, loading faster than my Xbox buddies, but some menu navigation issues here and there were difficult to ignore. These games themselves run very well, but really push your computer's GPU, which means don't expect to play high end games for long without charging. That is to be expected.The material that makes this computer aren't the best, but good for the money. It's not the most delicate computer, but maybe don't go crazy and throw it or spill anything on it. It's a bit heavy if you plan to vibe out in bed or on the couch. Definitely don't game with this thing on your lap. Keyboard is so-so. Maybe don't eat over this computer unless you are okay with crumbs in the keyboard. Speakers are fantastic in my opinion. You can connect some Bluetooth speakers or earphones easily if you think otherwise.The AN515 model, the cheaper 800$ish you're likely looking at, you'll gonna lacking in RAM and SSD memory. It's not the end of the world...who am I kidding? 250gb SSD? That's way to small! Maybe consider the models with more RAM and Storage. They can run between 1000-1200$, but if you can afford it, or upgrade the RAM and storage yourself, it makes a world of difference. The most you'll need is an external HDD, which is maybe 80$ for 1tb. Still cheaper than most laptops and desktops.The Nitro 5 is definitely the best computer for a budget or if you're starting out and want a computer you can play right out the box. This can replace your Xbox, or a spare Xbox when you have friends over. This plays the majority of PC games at good resolution and framerate.  As a casual laptop for websurfing, videos, programming, Photoshop, you're in good hands, and can be easily upgraded if RAM or memory is an issue. Think of it as a portable desktop, or even a portable Xbox. You won't be disappointed, especially at this price. Great for newcomers.
Awesome laptop. I purchased the laptop for my son and he's very happy with it. The games run fine and graphics are awesome. Highly recommend. The laptop was also delivered with care.

reviewTitle: Buena computadora y bastante práctica para juegos de bajos y medios requisitos
reviewDescription: Fue un regalo, pero quién lo recibió me ha dicho que le ha servido bastante y puede jugar el helldivers 2 sin problemas.

reviewTitle: The nitro key is THE WORST, it absolutely RUINS this model, and is DRIVING ME INSANE
reviewDescription: It sounds silly, but there is one fatal flaw in this laptop design: the 'nitro' key. This key is positioned next to the Backspace key, and absolutely RUINS the user experience. It's so bad it makes me want to toss this laptop out the window and buy a different one (I don't have the money). Whoever designed this needs to be FIRED, and I don't say that lightly. I'm pro-worker! Pro-union! Extremely anti-nitro key. Definitely a fireable offense, I'm sorry. Terrible oversight. The should fire the designer's supervisor as well, and perhaps every product tester they employed. Just my 2-cents.Imagine you're typing up a paper for work or school. When you inevitably reach up to tap the Backspace key, your finger isn't perfectly centered. Maybe your nails are slightly too long, causing you fingertip to slip, or perhaps you were typing a bit too fast and your coordination lagged for a moment. It doesn't matter the reason, because the reality is that you're gonna hit that ridiculous "nitro" button, positioned immediately behind the Backspace key. After that you have approximately 2 seconds to close out of the start-up prompt before the computer fully engages the program, opening it over top of whatever important thing you were working on and turning your laptop's fans on jet engine mode (opening the program that manages this laptop's fans is apparently very taxing for the laptop????).Trust me, this WILL happen to you, and it will happen A LOT. SO MUCH. It's really driving me insane, but you cannot grasp just how often I open the annoying fan app on my laptop when all I want to do is fix my dang typos. And you gotta wait for the program to boot up, it's not like you have the time to keep typing while it loads. I begged my boyfriend (a computer science graduate) to help me turn off the sticky key, creating a dead useless nitro key that takes up space on my keyboard for no reason. He did, and everything was OK for a while, but guess what? Acer must've done some crazy update or something, BECAUSE THE NITRO KEY IS BACK and as annoying as ever. When you go to the Acer website, desperate for a way to get relief from the terrible nitro key, THE INSTRUCTIONS THEY PROVIDE ARE USELESS. The options that their example solution provides literally DO NOT EXIST. The fact they had to dedicate a page of their website to turning off their terrible nitro key says a lot, but the fact that their instructions to do so are completely wrong says even more. The nitro key is cursed I tell you! Cursed!DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR SANITY. DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. LAPTOP. If you're ignoring my warning and press on, I'll give an honest review on some other features:- anti-glare screen is actually very nice and useful, though I was a bit put off by it at first- key backlighting only works once you've pressed a key, not just from moving the mouse; good luck finding that first key in the dark lol. hopefully you don't accidentally press that nitro key...- battery dies fast; you get about 2.5 hours unplugged, even brand new out of the box- fans are way too loud. yeah, i get to play my favorite games, but I can't hear them unless I have my earbuds in and turned up to the point of damaging my poor cochleas- you cannot adjust fan settings. even if you drag the little dials that determine each fan's power, they literally do nothing. I think it's like when you're at a crosswalk and you press that little button to make it switch to pedestrian crossing faster but it doesn't really do anything except pacify you. that's what the fan settings on this laptop are like.- audio quality sucks noticeably, plus this laptop never gets loud enough to hear over its godforsaken fans- i like that this laptop has some weight to it, it doesn't feel super fragile and paper-thin like so many others on the market todayDo not buy this laptop. Trust me. It's a piece of junk.

reviewTitle: Will not turn on or charge after 4 days of using it.
reviewDescription: Firstly, I would like to mention that despite the fact that this laptop stopped working after 4 days, the other features and performance of it were very positive. If it wasn't for it dying, I would leave a 5 star review.Secondly, I would like to mention that I know how to do maintenance on laptops, and I can't locate a simple problem like a lose cord. So the problem is nothing simple.Thirdly, I have been handling this laptop far better than all the others I have ever owned. And this one has not even moved from the spot I had it in.I received this laptop Sunday night (7/21/24) and set it up the same night. The next morning, I had everything installed and signed in and it was working great. Opening applications fast, running several different things at once well. And I even upgraded the RAM by 16gb (so it had 24gb) so it ran games a lot better too. The laptop would not turn on or charge Wednesday morning (7/24/24). It was completely locked up.VERDICT: IF this laptop did not die, it would've been spectacular. ONLY IF you are willing to gamble 750-ish dollars on this laptop, and have it either die or do great, I recommend fully.

reviewTitle: Amazon won’t guarantee what you get!
reviewDescription: We bought this laptop NEW for our son for Christmas last year. Right before Christmas, we unpackaged the laptop to get it all set up so it was ready to go Christmas morning. To our surprise - the laptop would not turn on. We tried several different ways and we still could not get the laptop to turn on. So, we called Acer customer service to see what was going on. The Acer rep told us that our laptop had been serviced in September for issues! We told him that that couldn’t be so because we just bought it brand new off of Amazon - he insisted that it was a refurbished laptop and even had case #’s for the services done to the laptop in September. We immediately called Amazon, to complain that we had purchased a new laptop from them and had received a used one. It took a half hour of bickering with the rep before she offered to “speak with her manager” to issue us a refund of the difference in price. Unfortunately, it was too close to Christmas to return and receive an actual new laptop in time for Christmas morning. Amazon eventually gave me the refund of the price difference and the rep stated that “Amazon has no control over whether a customer receives a refurbished or NEW laptop!” Are you kidding me?! They are sure to make you pay different price points though - even though they don’t know what you’re actually going to receive.Although - my son was thrilled to get this laptop - you can imagine our disgust. To top it off - the laptop lasted less than six months before the screen went out on it. Do you think I can find a replacement screen? What a joke. Buyer beware.

I bought this less than a month ago but I'm already having this issue. Every time I play a game, it goes black screen with fans, keyboard and mouse on. I only play classic games and not AAA games. Temperature is at 50-70s. The only fix is to force shut down which is kinda annoying. It works perfectly well if you only use it for browsing and work but not for gaming.

When I recieved the laptop, it was in perfect physical condition, but it kept crashing due to hypervisor errors during setup (every 3-5mins) It also kept losing connection to the wifi. After spending about 4 hours giving it the benefit of the doubt trying to make sure it had all its updated drivers (it arrived with roughly 2 hours of updates missing) the same error still occurred every 3-5 mins. I called acer, after some quick troubleshooting, they requested for me to send it out to them. The shipping & repair time were quick. I recieved it back within the 5-10 days promised, only to find... the exact same error. It immediately threw identical hypervisor errors (I dont know how Acer support missed those and said it was fixed) to which I called acer, and they said I'd need to mail it back.  Thankfully, I wasn't outside of Amazon's return policy yet, so I returned it to the seller instead. Take the 1* reviews seriously; my husband and I saw a few people had issues, so we tested ours almost immediately. The specs on the device are great, but we were given an error-riddled device.

Bought 2 months ago screen kept flashing and kicked me out of my game. Sent in for repair all they did was flash bios and reinstall windows. Tried to install game and play but they locked me out and I can't install drivers because they are the administrator now..... call support again they are sending me a recovery drive...... two and a half weeks later call again they never sent the drive and say it will be another 2 to 3 days for a confirmation email and 6 to 8 days delivery. Basically I have a paperweight "gaming" computer.

This laptop worked fantastically for a good few days but it started to degrade quickly. The screen would randomly go black then would fix itself after a few seconds which is concerning since I just bought this laptop. After a few more days I was trying to play a game online and my fans ramped up to 100 and there’s nothing I can do to fix it. Not to mention this entire time I’ve owned this laptop the battery life has just been crap. I do not recommend this money and I will probably look into getting a refund if I cannot resolve this issue.

It works great if it works. The specs are great but the battery keeps saying it doesn't detect the charger ans literally kills itself before it will charge. It's so annoying. This is the key flaw with this laptop. I haven't found a fix for it yet.

reviewTitle: Might have been nice, but it's dead right out of the box
reviewDescription: Power brick is live, but no life at all from the Acer.  No fans, no LEDs, held down power button for minutes, paper clipped the reset button in back.  Stayed cold.  Don't know what's up with it, but it's a brick

reviewTitle: Return within 24 hours.  DO NOT BUY!!!
reviewDescription: Don’t waste your money.  If I could it 0 stars I would.  Was setting it up and turned off within 30 minutes.  Would not turn back on and customer support was no help.  Don’t waste your time with this Laptop.

Mi ladtop tardo en llegar, x problemas de envio pero llego al final. Es de execelente material y es leas a lo q se promociona. Teclas suaves y todo bien protegido para q te llegue a tus manos. Excelente calidad de cargado y aun estoy probando respuesta de sistema y sus cosas

I used to play world of warcraft 11 years ago but the game got ahead of my technology. So I had to give it up. in  Facebook group I saw this laptop recommended as a good value for a gaming laptop. I decided to treat myself. I love it! I love how the keyboard lights up, I love how it boots up quickly, the great response in gameplay. The only thing that I do not like about it is the battery life is like 3 hours. I called the acer help desk to see is this is a problem. I was told that this is normal. This is not a problem for me because I do not travel and can plug it in when I need the battery recharged. This might be a problem for other folks.

It's not going to win any races. It's not the fastest, but it gets the job done. I added a larger RAM kit and a second hard drive, because that is the kind of thing I do, but it was very usable right out of the box.

reviewTitle: Incredible gaming PC when on a budget!
reviewDescription: LOVE this computer. Bought this to replace a near-10 year old computer I had which was on it's last legs. I knew I wanted a computer which was capable of playing high-graphics games at a decent fps, and this computer delivers.Great graphics quality, very good processing speed, good sound quality, good storage. My only issue, and this is pretty minor, is that the cooling fans are a bit loud. But they definitely are doing their job, and I so far haven't had any issues with my computer feeling too hot.8/10 purchase. Only wish the fans were a bit quieter, and the storage was a bit bigger. Otherwise, an excellent computer.

Sin problema, sin conflicto entre programas, fácil manejo y las opciones, casi que XP parte tres o Windows Vista parte 2, me encantó, la pantalla cuesta acostumbrarse si trabajas con programas viejos que no estén hechos para HD, he jugado Starcraft y no chistea
Came in good condition, excellent performance for price been gaming on it solid for about a month and I gotta say it does not disappoint
Rápido, un obsequio para mi sobrino q estudia Diseño Gráfico. Excelente maquina

reviewTitle: Excellent secondary or beginner gaming computer.
reviewDescription: I bought the Acer Nitro 5 with the i5 10300H CPU and the RTX 3050. I upgraded to 16 GB of RAM and added a 1 TB internal SSD and the review is based on the computer after the upgrades.Pros:-The visual fidelity is outstanding. Games like Battlefield 4 and 5 run perfectly and look amazing. Forza -Horizon 4 runs amazing at high FPS around 80 to 90 on high settings.-The Windows home screen and Cortana work great since it has a built in mic and designated buttons on the keyboard. Much better usage than on a PC.-It is very lightweight and portable.-Screen has soft colors but is very crisp.-Boot times are very fast.Cons-The battery life is atrocious but who isn't gaming without plugging in first? Watching Youtube only the battery lasted unplugged around 3 hours.-The laptop gets pretty warm and the fans are loud almost instantly loading into a game. This is not a huge issue for anyone wearing headphones.-The layout of the keyboard is very tight and you will click the wrong keys at some point. Also the touchpad is in a very strange position offset to the left so you'll want to disable it and use a mouse.Overall, this is a fantastic laptop for anyone getting into gaming computing. I own a PC with a 2080ti and even still am impressed by this little computer. The budgeting option to spend $168 a month for 5 months was a no brainer to me. If you are going to buy a laptop for any reason, might as well get a gaming one like this!

I bought this for my 9 yr old grandson. the Acer Nitro 5 AN515-55-53E5 Gaming Laptop, and he's loving it! The Intel Core i5-10300H processor and NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 Laptop GPU make it a powerhouse for gaming and other tasks. The 15.6" FHD 144Hz IPS Display is a visual treat, and the backlit keyboard is a nice touch. The laptop is sleek and stylish, and I love the way it looks. Overall, I’m very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking for a high-performance gaming laptop.
Call of duty, Helldivers, And Star Citizen on Ultra with little to no problems

First off, thank you for the reviews saying to ignore the 1 star "won't turn on reviews." 2 clicks when plugging it in!Arrived on time, runs great, and it'll run all the newest games, for probably several years to come as it's an rtx with directx12 ultra.  I went with the cheapest option, mainly just wanted to turn on Ray Tracing in Minecraft, yet totally impressed. It's an i5, but one made specifically for gaming, 3 times the voltage, twice the thread count, and slightly better then the i7 9th and Ryzen 5. Currently the 6th best benchmarked chip despite being now 2 gens old. Ram is easy to upgrade, just a couple screws.As for frames per second, I could only find 2 games that dropped it under 100 in performance mode/game mode with ultra on: Cyberpunk at 70, and ghost recon at 45.I'd say it's weakest link is actually the wifi. Plugging in an Ethernet I was capped by Steam at 100mbs, but wirelessly, 10mbs.  Even did a broadband check at speakeasy, 10mbs. Fiddled with every setting, driver and windows update to no avail. Still happy with my purchase, just seems weird I could of downloaded 7 times faster with any other device in the house.

So first off for the price of this laptop, you get a whole lot! Since my purchase it’s been nothing but great, great screen, fast, and gaming is absolutely fine! I highly recommend this purchase if your looking for budget friendly laptop as well as solid performance!

At this price, you'll have a hard time finding the same raw power anywhere else. So far, I've played No Man's Sky and Planetside 2 (at default settings) with no framerate issues that I can notice. Minecraft with RTX also works. It has a few framerate hiccups, but I've seen the same from some desktop RTX cards.The screen is nice. The colors aren't washed out by the backlight, like in other laptops, and the higher refresh rate makes everything feel liquidy smooth.A big factor that drives the price down is, of course, the storage. The more modern games you'll probably want to play on this machine are usually 50+ GB in size, and at that rate, the 250 GB hard drive is going to fill up in no time. Just remember that the storage is extremely upgradeable--another feature that's hard to find in laptops at this price point. Don't need a ton of storage? Great, enjoy the low price. Need more storage? The option's there for you when you're ready.P.S. I was wary at first, because Acer has a bit of a "you get what you pay for" reputation. But I've had it for about a month now, and haven't encountered any issues. I also purchased the 4-year protection plan, just in case.

reviewTitle: Great upgrade from using a business laptop where GPU is part of CPU
reviewDescription: Very impressed with this my first gaming laptop. While personally I have always owned Macs, I down have ownership of a few noteworthy games that are now Windows only I had to finally bite the bullet. Veryimpressed so fr. I had 2 "disappointment, none are earth shattering, while I would have loved to change the color of the keyboard, I'll settle for it lighting when I need it with a steady red glow. Also not that keen on Win 11 but I'm smart enough not to try and retro fit the OS.  I will be looking at additional drive storage, but the memory was a wise choice at 16GB. I see there are icon above the keyboard, but they do not light up and the also would have been handy. But is working and doing a great job!
I bought this for my grandson, he says it a very good laptop he loves it

This is my first laptop after a decade and I am very happy to purchase this one. So many good words about Nitro 5s, even this one is not one of the better ones, I added another 8Gb ram and 2 TB 2.5 SSD to make it bit more usable. Not that anything wrong with 8Gb ram and 256Gb SSD but 8Gb rams are not that expensive at all these days.. I had 2TB SSD from my big computer, just switched it over. Talking about upgrading the laptop, it's so easy. Comes with everything you need to add another 2.5 SSD. YouTube videos helped me out though, made my job a lot easier. This computer does play FPS games, and plays them very smooth. The fans start running though, and you might think it's overheating, that's not the case, it's normal. They don't go full speed. I also play mobile games and stream through laptop... no heating no fan issues at all... it's like so smooth and easy for the machine. For this price, I highly recommend it, if you are in a tight budged like I am. One more thing for this laptop, I am going to travel Europe next year, and it won't be problem bringing it with me, since it is travel friendly :)
Perfect Xmas gift for my 14 yr old who had been asking for a gaming computer.

reviewTitle: Great Visuals. Great for Technical Work. Great Computer
reviewDescription: This computer works well as promised.I'm a freelancer helping clients with video editing/marketing work and find this laptop to be a great upgrade to my prior equipment.Running programs such as CAPCUT, Adobe Premiere, and online courses are smooth and effective.Very smooth. Happy I bought it.

reviewTitle: Just what I needed... it delivered
reviewDescription: Awsome... great price. .

reviewTitle: The perfect mobile flight sim computer
reviewDescription: X that I could take on vacations or winter get-a-ways that had the capability of running X Plane 12 and this fills the bill !

While I enjoyed the computer initially, after purchasing a new 1tb hard drive to install in the machine, I've realized the geniuses at ACER have made it almost impossible to change the boot order in BIOS, making it impossible to install Windows from a USB. Why any company in their right mind would do this, I don't know.. but I wouldn't recommend wasting your money on this trash.Edit - So I ended having to return the new drive that I bought for the laptop, and purchased an M2 drive, to replace the one that was in there, this was how I solved the problem. The laptop has the ability to add 2  M2 drives, and one 2.5 drive. I wanted to remove the M2 drive that came with it, and just install the 1tb 2.5 SSD... but that was not possible, and I was in contact with support on multiple occasions. Since then, I have had no issues with the laptop. I wish it could be upgraded past 32gb RAM, but I guess this are the limitations that come when buying a "budget" laptop, which this considered to be. Laptop works great for what I use it for, which is video editing. I don't use it for any gaming, so can't speak on that part.

reviewTitle: FEW PROBLEMS BUT IT WAS WORTH THE COST
reviewDescription: Model & Specs: Acer Nitro 5 AN515-55-53E5 | Intel Core i5-10300H | NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050I had this laptop for a little over 2 years and, despite the problems, I'm pretty happy with it.First a Warning: The new laptop didn't turn on and I thought it was DOA but it was b/c you have to push the power plug fairly hard into it to hear the *snap*.Whether for gaming or something else, its CPU & GPU are strong, but you'll need to buy additional SSD & RAM to really make it shine.PROS:- The CPU & GPU are excellent for the price. (This is the biggest PRO)- Great cooling ~ I never had an overheating problem while using a cooling pad.- Easy access to multiple slots for adding extra Storage & RAM.- Backlit keyboard is really nice, even when using it in a well-lit room.CONS:- 2 USB ports died after 10 months. Sending it in for repairs takes over a week so I had to buy the $50 part and replace it myself.- The mousepad started acting jumpy and annoying to use. No problems with using a mouse but sucks for pad users and I've never had this problem with other laptops before.- The Delete [Del] key, in the top-right corner, is moved one space to the left and [Home] key is in its place. Didn't think moving 1 key out of place would be so annoying but I always find myself pressing the "Home" key when I want to press "Delete."

I've been searching and reading about all the different laptops because they don't make them like my old Toshiba laptop anymore. Mine finally died after replacing parts for over 12 years. This one was missing the RGB customization for the keyboard and I love having 2 mouse click buttons at the bottom of the mouse touchpad but it's impossible to find that now besides the Lenovo's Thinkpad. The camera quality could be better than expected and some of the keyboard keys are smaller when trying to type on here but I think this should suffice me for the next several years. I'd suggest buying a webcam for clear picture quality if purchasing this and using it a lot. I also think for the price, they could've made the "N" logo on the bottom of the screen light up as well with the keyboard.BTW**TO DISABLE THE TIMEOUT ON THE BACKLIT KEYBOARD:You have to go into Nitrosense. Personal Settings. Keyboard. Press the toggle button next to Disable 30-second backlit keyboard timeout.These instructions are different from the other laptops and took me days to figure out 😅

The Specs and the price were a great match when I bought it. The laptop is noisy while playing as all the fans start. You can add more memory according to your needs. It comes with a padded sleeve, so you can carry it in a non-laptop-friendly backpack.
It meets what my boy needs for his perfect higher education engeering requirements.
Using it to write this review right now!Powerful gaming machine with great memory and gpu which can run all modern games at max settings.Battery last no time, has to be plugged in regularly.

reviewTitle: Great for quick set up gaming
reviewDescription: Really big fan of this laptop. It handles modern games extremely well, the screen is a great mix of size and quality. The biggest thing to keep in mind, this is a great machine for transporting from house to house, or coffee shop, or office. This does not do well with long battery life. It's a great solution if you are trying to save on space or know you will need to move every now and then to another work/game area.This is not an everyday carry to do office work on the airplane or train. The laptop battery goes fast, and the whole setup is on the heavier side.If you need something to travel with, this isn't it.If you want something you can set up at home, but the ease to move it every now and then to take elsewhere, this is exactly what you want.
¡Muy buen servicio! El artículo llegó intacto y al tiempo indicado.
Great upgrade from my last computer
Its a great gaming laptop, especially for the price. My only complaint is that the battery drain is awful. A less than 10 min game play took it from 80 to 40 something. Great otherwise.

Going in, I thought this might be a disappointment. It was at first because I fell pray to the tricky charging port. I plugged it in, didn't turn on at all. I unplugged, tried again. Nothing. I was furious. I called support and they did tell me it was tricky. You have to push it into the port harder than you think and it will click. I will admit, I was being gentle because it was a new laptop, but push the port in a little harder than you think and it will click and charge. I felt so stupid. It's unusual to have to be a little rough, but it has worked spectacularly and I haven't had a problem at all. Runs everything I need it to run and runs online games flawlessly. I will buy another one when they are on sale again.

reviewTitle: An excellent option for limited budget!
reviewDescription: So, I was tracking it's price for a few months and it reached it lowest price in Black Friday so I didn't hesitate. After almost six months of use I'm really glad of the results, I bought it mostly for work, present content in virtual meetings while having some programs running. Since the beginning I only ran a few games (Halo Infinite and Destiny) because the storage is a huge limitation, but after a few months I bought an extra ssd plus 8gb for ram and the results are really admirable. Must games run smoothly at high definition (not top but four out of five) and in some more demanding games you can still play in good quality. Lately I plugged it to the tv (standard Samsung) to play a little more comfortable and my experience has been really pleasant. No crashes until now. I've tried RE2, DBZ Fighterz, COD and FIFA22.

reviewTitle: 3 months in and it still seems to be running great
reviewDescription: I had this laptop about 3 months now and everything still seems to be doing pretty good. the temp never went over 200 degrees F... but I do have it on a cooling pad, and I turn the internal cooling fans on the highest settings with the nitro sense when i play something somewhat intensive and I don't play many intensive games. the I5 core will most likely have a rough time playing the latest games but it will run something like escape from tarkov like butter at 75 to over 100 fps in ultra-settings. you might want to get another 8gig stick of ram to pop in and upgrade the ssd storage but over all I'm very satisfied for what this computer is and can do. it is my very first gaming laptop and I feel it somewhat replaced my xbox. for someone who's never had a dedicated laptop for gaming or a computer at all, I feel this is one of the best first steps into pc gaming.

reviewTitle: Push the plug in all the way!
reviewDescription: This was the first gaming computer I ever bought, so I had no idea that the plugs were different from regular computers. When I first plugged it in and tried to turn it on, nothing happened. I thought I got a bum computer! I called the number on the package and was told that gaming computers have different plugs than standard computers, and that I had to push the plug into the back of the computer all the way until I heard a click. I thought I had, but when I pushed on it again I heard the click and it started right up.Onto the computer itself... the graphics are great, the speed has worked well for all the games used so far (Minecraft, Bloons TD6, etc.), the picture is vivid, and I have no complaints so far!

Being able to upgrade a laptop, and was easy to do, with a great screen, fast processor, good graphics, and efficient cooling, for a good price was important to me and this one checked all the boxes. I've been using this laptop for about 3 weeks now and I love it. The only issue I have is using a KVM switch to switch between my work computer and this one using a single monitor, this laptop would not switch back. So, I would have to unplug the HDMI cable and plug it back in to get it to switch. Not sure why this is happening. Tried several different cables but still same problem. It could be the switch I'm using but it does work with an older laptop I have. Other than that it's a great laptop.

reviewTitle: Great laptop for my 12 year old
reviewDescription: I bought this laptop for my 12 year old. It’s his first laptop and he mainly uses it to play Roblox. It works well for him and the price wasn’t so bad.
For the price, does well and runs games smoothly
Using it for work - mostly office stuff.  It is fast and quiet.  Love it.  And it looks cool

I mainly got this gaming laptop for the sims 4 because I have almost every single add on you can get for it and a few mods. I have been playing on a regular laptop for years! It was always so laggy and took forever to load even to just the main screen. I had it now for about 2 ish months and WOW it works amazing and runs smoothly. I also have Apex Legends and Life is Strange installed and they also run amazingly smooth!! I do have a lot of add on and mods so my sim game is the tiniest bit lag but not enough to bother me! I give is a solid 9.5/10 I gave it a 9.5 because it does get hot so I got a cooling laptop stand and haven’t had any problems so far!
