Returning and refunding. Tech support was very helpful in making my return and refund. Again- do not waste your time with this Acer Nitro 5 laptop. It should be taken off the Amazon site as a whole.

This laptop says it's for gaming but you can't even run dual monitors. It has one. ONE! HDMI out port and the USB-C port isn't lighting so you can't run a monitor on it. Even after buying a USB 3.0 doc for it with an additional HDMI port on it you still can't run a second monitor.

reviewTitle: Plugged in for 8 hours to charge and no charging lights, computer wouldnt even turn on.
reviewDescription: We received this laptop yesterday. Plugged it in for almost 8 hours to charge. No lights came on showing it was charging. Pushed the power button. Nothing. No pull tabs, or on off switch. This is a $700+ paperweight.  Now just waiting for UPS to pick it up so we can get a refund. I do not recommend buying this.

reviewTitle: Can't fulfill it's purpose as a laptop
reviewDescription: Only bought this for the portability that supposedly comes with owning a laptop. However the battery life is awful and it consistently drops connection on Wi-Fi every 10-15 minutes. If I wanted to be plugged into a router and a wall I would just use a desktop.Waste of money.

reviewTitle: 1/5. Unlucky Dead on Arrival for this guy...
reviewDescription: I wish I could give this 5 stars...Dead on Arrival. Returned 1 hour after opening. Unlucky I guess.That said, it's a nice build and the weight/form factor surprised me.I have an Acer chromebook, so I do trust them for quality. The return process is simple:just print label and drop it off at a UPS store. Good luck to everyone!

Did not manage to use it really. Mainly have it stored on the shelf and use about 10 times. Last week start to look for ssd to increase storage, and screen died, completely. Honestly it's very disappointing. So far it's my worst purchase.

We bought this computer in June of 2022. It is now January 2024. It's not even 2. so the computer wasn't holding a charge, we took it to a computer repair shop and they told us that the charging port on the motherboard is needs to be fixed.  So so we called the company talk to Tech Support. And because the warranty limited 1 year ran out after a year and a 1/2. The goddam thing broke? And they want to charge $500 to fix it.  And no, no remorse, not a care in the world. Because the limited warranty ran out! I am so pissed. $725 Computer and they want to charge another 500 to fix a charging port on a motherboard. And not even have a care in the world. Customer service sucks!!  I would've given it zero stars but it won't let me

🚨 DO NOT BUY!!!!!! 🚨This was supposed to be a gift for my son’s 14th birthday. Unfortunately when we tried powering it on it wouldn’t turn on. No indicator light that it was charging. It gets worse, when I tried to return it I wished to get a replacement one sent out but I was informed that it was not an option. Only a refund . Fine I agreed to that but then I was sent a return label that needs to be printed out. I requested a QR code but they didn’t want to provide me with one . Long story short I am now waiting for a return label to be delivered to me . Once it’s all said and done I’ll have to wait 30 days for a refund!! Horrible product and horrible customer service. Epic fail for my son’s birthday. Thank you Amazon and Acer!

reviewTitle: DOA-DON’T DO IT, ITS RUSSIAN ROULETTE
reviewDescription: Like a moth to a flame I was mesmerized by the value and great review ratings and I ignored the fact that there are at least SIX REVIEWS IN THE LAST TWO WEEKS saying their machine (like mine) wouldn’t even turn on!! Most stores would recognize this as a problem but Amazon shamefully just keeps selling this junk.  This was in my house 3 hours before I got my money back along with arrangements for them to pick up the craptop at my door to return it.  I will find another (non Acer) laptop, and I will buy it from somewhere other than Amazon.  There has to be a price to pay for knowingly selling defective products.EDIT:  Just want to address the “you have to press the charger plug in extra hard” comments from other reviews. Imagine you buy a brand new car and the dealer tells you that you need to use extra force when you close your door otherwise it will stay open and the car won’t run.  Are you going to be ok with that? Not me. And even if that’s the issue,  why didn’t support know it when I talked to them?  Also why is the battery at zero % therefore requiring the charger to power up? My replacement MSI worked perfectly right out of the box.

It’s only been 2 years and my screen is completely black. I’ve only used it to play The Sims (only during the summer) and create a few PowerPoints. Also, the batter life has always been horrible. I don’t even think it has ever lasted a full hour (no games being played).This shouldn’t be an issue for a laptop that was barely used (only during summer months).
My computer has been randomly shutting off and I just want a refund doesn’t run even the sims and 10 year old game

I have been in the IT world for over 20 years. I left the laptop on the charger and woke up to a cracked screen. Called Acer support and they wouldn't cover my cracked screen. Two days later the computer would no longer turn on. Acer Support said that a cracked screen can stop a computer from working and it's not covered.Remember, I have been in IT for over 20 years so I'm not stupid. I have worked on hundreds of computers and never seen a screen issue stop the whole computer form working.So I guess after just little over 120 days I now have an expensive paperweight. I thought I would give this Acer a try because of a good Prime Day deal but this was my first Acer and my last because the support is so horrible. The Agent wouldn't listen to me and played games with me to get me waisting my time to get me off the phone.I would suggest paying a little more and go with a company that actually supports their products.

I got this pc for solely entertainment purposes, and when i download league of legends, it keeps lagging really bad, when i checked task manager, the ram is already at 70% preoccupied, which is very unusual for a brand new pc. Also, this pc does not recognize my headset and gave me a hard time.
Waste of time.

reviewTitle: Can’t open games 75% of the time
reviewDescription: I got this laptop to play with my friends on Roblox but it never open it closes on its own so I tried a Minecraft and guess what doesn’t work your better off buying a laptop like ones you get at school they can at least open games.
Just bought this "gaming" laptop, and all it does is crash.
Perfect!!.

The product came perfectly. Everything works smoothly. I’m very happy with this product. For those that say it doesn’t come on just plug the charger to the computer, when you hear one click sound push it in a bit harder until you hear a second one, plug the charger to an outlet and there you go. It happened to me and I thought I bought a computer that doesn’t even come on but then I remember a review I saw and it worked.Received within one week to Guyana!
good choice

El equipo es un buen equipo, si estas buscando un equipo para jugar. En cuanto a portabilidad es un poco pesado, si estas buscando un equipo de facil transporte este equipo no es el tuyo. Si lo que buscas es un equipo para jugar y hacer tus deberes diarios sin necesidad de tanta movilidas, es perfecto

I dont usually write reviews but i purchased this laptop for my son whos a gamer and this thing is a BEAST! YES we did some mods and utilized some of the upgradable features to make it a little better which cost us all of a couple hundred bucks and let me tell you for a teenage boy he is STOKED! Im one happy momma for the price and hes rockin and rollin! It has a fan better then his bedroom fan and he can do his college work, game, watch his videos, etc and im confident i wont be replacing it for years to come! The warranty amazon offers for it is AMAZING also! If your on the fence DONT be! JUST DO IT!

I bought this....2 years ago? 3? It's been serving me very very well. You're gonna have to pop it open and add a larger SSD but otherwise it's a solid laptop for the price. I can blow through games at non-4k resolution well, it handles VR, did some programming on it. It's great I love it to death

reviewTitle: Perfect for modern gaming without overdoing it on the budget
reviewDescription: Supremely happy with this purchase. Got it for Black Friday and I absolutely love it. Would've been worth the price even without the BF discount to be quite honest.Excellent high refresh rate, high resolution monitor. Runs smoothly. The keyboard feels light and good to the touch. Very light for its size and zero noise from the fans.

reviewTitle: Great for getting started on PC gaming but...
reviewDescription: So, I got this laptop so I could start pc gaming for the first time, and I love it so far. However, the first day of having it, I've noticed that the charging indicator would flash orange nonstop after a full. I've tried calibrating the battery(No flash for 2 days), battery resetting(No flash for 10 hours), unplugging the battery(No change). None of these things would get that darn light to stop flashing. So, to remedy this issue, I've changed the battery. Low and behold, it never has flashed orange since. First thing I recommend with this laptop is change the battery ASAP for two reasons. 1. The battery life isn't very long. 2. Prevent that issue that I ran into when buying mine.(plus it lasts 4 hours longer than the one it came with.)I haven't hit my 80 Days with it. So, I will update this review when I do if I run into any other problems.

This is the first computer I've ever bought myself now at 18. Previously my dad would usually get the PCs that were being replaced where he worked in IT. I never had a computer that could run the beefy games that I like smoothly and this was the first to ever do it and do it well. It doesn't overheat and the fans are great.My 16 year old brother eyed my computer and loved it so much that he bought one for himself.You really can't go wrong with such great specs and RTX 3050. The only thing that I've altered is the ram. Please do yourself a favor and get 32GB to see this baby run like hell. Purchase this computer.TLDR: Buy this and buy 32GB of DDR4 ram.

This is a great entry gaming laptop for my 12 year old who will be 13 next month. The colors and graphics are great, he loves the lighted keyboard, and this definitely has a bit of weight which contributes to the sturdiness. I also like that it’s also just a great laptop as well. We were able to upgrade for Windows 11 for free.  At home, he now uses this computer vs the school assigned Chrome, for his Zoom math tutoring sessions (the camera and microphone is decent we still use a separate microphone), and to also complete his homework on Google classroom.Other features: I also like the number of inputs which has more than my Lenovo X1 Carbon ThinkPad, and the  ability to wirelessly connect the laptop to your tv as a second extended screen is pretty cool.Overall this was a present for his good grades, and it also works great for homework assignments and video conferencing as added bonuses.

I would say that there are a lot of problems that I am not sure whether to attribute to the laptop itself or to windows 11 being terrible. Basic functionality like, "If you close your lid, you'll need to restart your computer every time you open it again or it won't play videos," or "The search button doesn't work at all," or "Plug and play usb functionality stops working and you need to unplug and replug things constantly."The hard drive space is too small too as my only hardware complaint, and that's easily remedied.Otherwise it's just fine I guess.

reviewTitle: Good specs for the price but the display is unacceptably bad.
reviewDescription: For a budget gaming laptop, this Acer Nitro 5 has good enough specs, the Core i5 and the RTX 3050 are sufficient. The problem and it's a big one, is the display. The image on this laptop is AWFUL. No matter how much I tried to calibrate the colors, it looks bad. The colors are washed and the screen is dim. whether it's game or a movie this screen won't do it justice. Too bad because I like many other aspects of this laptop like the relatively long battery life and the red-colored keyboard. I find myself playing more on my 2 years old Legion 5 which looks way better than this newer Acer Nitro 5. Even for under $1000, you can get something better.

reviewTitle: Looked good on paper, but underperformed
reviewDescription: Bought this to play games with friends since GPUs are astronomically overpriced and this laptop was extremely underwhelming. The screen is very dark and the colors are so muddled and muted. I expected more from a 144hz display. The GPU could barely handle running call of duty on the lowest settings at 1080p. The biggest downfall however is the SSD storage space. I opted for this model over a more expensive model because it was cheaper to add on an addition 2.5" drive than the model with a 1tb ssd from the get go. This laptop refuses to acknowledge any SSD I plugged into it. Save your money and buy something else.

reviewTitle: Sent it back. It failed twice within the first two weeks
reviewDescription: I had to return the Acer Nitro to Amazon.  The computer failed to boot properly twice within the first two weeks and both times it said the system needed to be completely reset before using it again.  I have had an Acer Aspire for more than 5 years and it has performed without a problem during that time, so I do not have the patience to keep wiping and resetting a brand new $800 dollar computer.Amazon did take the computer back without question, so that part was good, but I'm still shopping for a dependable, start-and-run-everytime-without-problems-computer for less than $1000 dollars. I don't know if they even exist anymore.

reviewTitle: My 2nd time getting this computer and it’s just okay
reviewDescription: Their are definitely better gaming laptops out there but this one is just okay. I’m kinda stressed out. This is my 2nd time buying a nitro 5 and they just seem like they are prone to breaking. First one just shut off and never turned on after having it for a couple months, my second one the ram, cpu and screen started acting up pretty much just messing up the whole laptop, only with in a couple months again. I enjoyed gaming in it but for the price you can definitely get something better or build something better.

I'm sorry to say, but I am so disappointed. They don't make things like they used to.After having this laptop for some time I've noticed some weird artifacting on the LCD/SCREEN.So, to explain, with night mode on or off you can see these rapidly moving lines that go through only certain colors like greys and blue's. This is unacceptable. It's very noticeable once you see it, and nothing software wise fixes it, so it's definitely a hardware problem.I painfully had to make the decision to return this and I'm very upset.

So I loved this laptop for a whole day. Thought it was great. But suddenly after just 24 hours, it’s broken. It says that my battery is at 100% yet if I unplug it, it automatically shuts off - just goes straight to black. If I wanted a device I had to keep plugged in to use, I’d have bought a desktop instead.

reviewTitle: BUYER BEWARE - Keyboard is not replaceable
reviewDescription: The laptop was designed so that the keyboard could not be replaced. Was shocked to find this out as that is a common thing to replace with a laptop. So FYI - if you break it, you're looking at buying a new laptop.It's a shame because it's not a bad budget gaming laptop otherwise.
Colors look dull, screen could be better

Laptop comes in the mail. Second day gets error and blue screen. Third day sparks and kills itself. Manages to turn on. The plug in port would beep nonstop and might shut off again as if the battery is nonexistent.
It is what it said it was. 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾
For the price you can't go wrong. Acer hasn't treated me wrong yet. 100% would recommend.
I had to add another SSD

reviewTitle: Debí de pedir una con más capacidad
reviewDescription: Todo excelente pero recomiendo comprar una con más capacidad
The battery life isn’t great but other than that it’s great
+Fast work, bright display,- 8GB ram is low for some programming
It works just fine.
Buena compra, su relacion precio/producto es 4/5
Wish the mouse pad was more centered. Easily bumped while playing
Looks great. Easy to configure.

reviewTitle: Didn’t live up to the description
reviewDescription: The only reason I’m rating this not good is because they claim it is more than strong enough to hook up an oculus quest 2 and run be gaming on it but in reality the games were so slow it wasn’t doable. I’m sure it’s good for some pc games but if the product isn’t what the description claims that’s a deal breaker for me

I have used this laptop for college and I have played a little bit of video games on it as well. I have always been careful with this laptop and I am genuinely careful with where I put it and how I use it. 18 months after buying this product, it has now had parts of the plastic crack in 3 different places without misuse of the product. The Plastic around the screen has cracked near the connecting points and the keyboard has cracked by the ethernet port without use of the ethernet port ever. This product is nice for school and videogames and streams videos and video games very well. Very disappointed in the quality of the plastic.

reviewTitle: It did not work out of the box.
reviewDescription: This laptop did not work out of the box. It had a loose cable on the motherboard that was preventing it from  booting. The webcam has one of the noisiest images I have ever seen.On the plus side it has great cooling, upgradeability and I love the keyboard. The memory and storage are lacking, but can be upgraded easily.The cpu is not horrible, but only having 4 cores is holding this laptop back. It is too easy to peg it to 100%. The battery is just ok. It could be a lot better.I would not call this a gaming laptop. It will be ok for casual gaming, but it is too easy to hit 100% cpu use. I would not get this unless you are planning on upgrading the memory and adding another m.2 driver.I would have rated it  3 stars if it turned on without needing me to take it apart.

reviewTitle: WAS A GREAT LAPTOP UNTIL IT WASN’T!
reviewDescription: i ordered this laptop on january 5, 2022. it worked great, i only used it for sims 4 including custom content and mods. only a little over two months later, the screen has went completely black. the computer is on and still works but you just can’t see anything. the fans and keyboard lights work fine. i connected it to the tv via HDMI and everything looks fine just can’t use it alone. i contacted the seller, no response. this computer was over $800 when i purchased it, not sure if it’s the same now. but for all that money, and the little bit of time bc that’s passed, i shouldn’t be having ANY problems with this computer. so if you’re thinking about buying, BE CAREFUL. also, you don’t have the option to get a refund, so love that for me!! 💀

reviewTitle: Restarting issues right out of the box
reviewDescription: The laptop worked good, I would have been happy with it. But my big issue was when I wanted to play a game. Since it IS a gaming laptop after all. The game would shut down and the computer would restart every ten minutes or so. I haven’t had this thing for a week yet and it won’t stop. I’ve tried every troubleshoot for this issue with Acers. Apparently it’s the most common issue. But nothing worked and I shouldn’t have to dig this much for a brand new computer with only one game installed.  I’m sending it back and going with a different brand.
It can hardly run fallout 4 on the lowest graphics settings. It’s so choppy it’s no longer fun to play.

reviewTitle: Audio drivers fail every other day. Avoid this one!
reviewDescription: This would be a decent laptop for light gaming and daily tasks, but every other boot, all audio devices, including the motherboard audio, will fail to show up in Windows. Like, at all. Reinstalling the drivers only provides a temporary fix. It'll be fine for like a week. Then they'll disappear again.Stay away from this laptop!
What I like about it it's Uber fast...but so is the battery losing even with some tips it just goes so fast

Produces allot of heat. Unless you have a cooling stand I wouldn't get it. Battery lasts about an hour. The power cord goes in the back and you have to make sure it's positioned right or the heat will start to melt it. Performs great otherwise.

When I received my Acer laptop it had what looked like a small ding in the top left corner of the screen-- to my disappointment, this meant there were very large, awful crack streaks & lines going down the side of the panel, rendering this laptop useless. Currently awaiting a refund. When I got it in the mail, the factory seal on the box was already broken, meaning this laptop may have been a refurb or previous return. I'm sure this laptop may otherwise be a great model. Buyers take caution.
My brother bought this on my account, didn’t realize that the i5 was 4 cores. Paired with the 3050 makes no sense. He likes it just for what he paid for it could’ve been better

The battery life is awful. I leave it unplugged for an hour (while lid is closed) and it dies on me. Other than that, it's okay. Gaming is about the same as you could get on a regular laptop. I just think it's overpriced.

Am writing this review from the actual laptop. So far, it's going well .... When this laptop arrived, it came with a protective box over the actual laptop box, that protective box was flawless BUT the laptop box was opened. The seal was propped up and the sack the laptop came in was upside down. I bought this laptop new. A sticker on the laptop has a little minor peal on it. I was hoping to keep it on for aesthetic reasons, but I might peal it off in the near future now.

I try to use this in class as well sometimes since I did spend several hundred dollars for it. No matter what fan settings you put it on it will randomly have moments where it sounds like a fighter jet in the middle of the room you're in. Even worse when actually gaming. Would tell myself not to buy it if I could go back in time.

Laptop doesn’t hold more than 2 MMO games. Decent graphics and nice looking laptop for price. The reason I gave it 3 stars instead of 5 is it doesn’t hold many DL games AND we bought 2 of these and one of them got a white screen of death after 4 days, had to plug it into our PC monitor just to see anything and to be able to clear everything off it to send it back and request a new one. So that really sucked.

reviewTitle: This laptop pc gaming rigs cpu runs really hot the i5 10300h runs hot
reviewDescription: I5 10300 H is a great CPU but it runs really hot normally around 95C which worries me because that’s the melting point I would recommend putting on a new layer of thermal paste to help you keep it optimal but it is a good gaming laptop I use it to play VR chat oblivion Destiny 2 and a few other games like the Sims but it it runs well and it also runs well playing fallout new Vegas
The computer was great! Until it started randomly glitching! If the screen is barley moved it blacks out and sometimes (as I’m the video posted) the screen just starts randomly glitching

reviewTitle: powerful, but SOO loud and SOO heavy
reviewDescription: yes, I can do video editing on it, but otherwise, I hate using it. can't wait till I can replace it.

It did not work on arrival had to clean power terminal. Than 3 months in stopped working completely had to send it back for fix. When it worked a nice laptop. For price though not a great machine should work out of box and for years not a few months.

If you're trying to play minecraft or other small games this is perfect, but AAA titles like Warzone and demanding games alike this isn't your best bet. For reference in warzone with the lowest possible settings you get 50fps on a good day.

This is less a review about the product than about Amazon. Yes, the product did quit working after three days and that's not great. However, Acer has offered me an option to get the laptop fixed. Unfortunately that means I'll be without it for an unknown period of time. What got this to a 1 star rating is that Amazon will not offer a replacement. They'll give me a refund but will not guarantee me the opportunity to purchase a replacement at the same deal. Thanks for nothing Amazon!

Came with a corrupted BIOS, which I fixed. BIOS was severely outdated, fixed. Came with 40 bloatware programs, also fixed. Had to configure 200 settings just to dual boot Ubuntu, another fix. Then I booted Windows 11 and Acer's software BIOS corrupted again, which I fixed, again. By uninstalling Acer's bloatware version of Windows and installing my copy of Windows 11. Worked for 2 weeks before corrupting Ubuntu to the point where I had to reinstall everything. I've been using Linux for 12 years, never had this much of an issue.See the problem here? I wanted to try something other than a Dell laptop and instantly regretted it, I'm past the 30 day return window just from troubleshooting and from what I've been seeing in the reviews I might as well use this laptop for parts and buy a Dell. I will never purchase an Acer product in my lifetime again.
It was decent till it gave me the black screen of death I’d go with a different brand

Costly for repair ,must pay for shippingCustomer service needs improvementRepaired laptop at computer repair store, aces wanted too much for a broken screen replacement,Only to find out aces ruined the motherboard when they removed the bottom panel of the laptop attempting to find why the screen wasn’t workingNow the cost is more than the computer !

It was functioning very well, but I noticed that it was getting kinda hot sometimes, I tried to turn it on two weeks ago and it didn't work. I'm from Venezuela, so it's hard for me to get a refund or change the product, so I sent it to a technician here that told me the mother board was broken. I hope you improve this kind of problems so they don't happen again!

Probably one of the worst laptops I've gotten, the storage is so little that you need to buy a more, the keyboard itself wasn't properly put together, it broke within and year and has been running on blood, sweat and tears until it stopped working altogether just recently. I reccomend putting your money towards a real computer.

I purchased two of these.  Neither worked properly.  The first one made a very loud clicking noise from the fan.  See video.  Returned it and received a second one. The new one would not turn on initially.  After trying for 30 minutes or so it finally started.  The next day, it would not turn on for several minutes again.  Now it seems to be completely bricked - Not working at all.  Not sure if I will try again.  First time Acer product user.  I’m not impressed

reviewTitle: Died less than two years old
reviewDescription: I suppose I should be grateful mine didn't die a month after warranty like some buyers, still for $900 I expect at least 3-4 years of use. It began with a swath of fine horizontal lines clustering near the top of the screen; they'd get worse and then it would freeze. This happened more frequently and sooner after power-up until I couldn't even get 15 minutes of use. I tried all suggestions at the Acer support website to no avail. No fix can cure poorly-built imports. After so many disappointments I have sworn off HP and Dell laptops. I will now add Acer to that list of Never Buy companies.

reviewTitle: Stop working after 2  years of use
reviewDescription: It stopped working after two years of use. A short circuit fried the processor. And it can't be repaired. I lost my money

reviewTitle: Half-functional - Other brands do it better.
reviewDescription: It's been a few weeks, the machine has the following issues;- Runs extremely hot during games, performance will still drop to sub ten FPS or hang completely. Alt-tabbing borderline lags out/crashes the machine.- USB ports on the left side fail to detect any and all new hardware, rendering the machine useless without a USB dock.- Sound coming out of the speakers is almost impossible to hear, so good luck watching videos/movies/etc. without headphones.The only good thing about this is the battery life, but since I spend most of my time with my machine plugged in because there's no way I'll be able to game on battery due to the performance drop battery life is useless to me.This is a very weak machine. Get an Alienware or MSI if you want a higher quality product. I've seen Dell and HP laptops sell for $200 that can do more than this joke of a machine can. If you want barebones that MIGHT be able to run some games? Sure. Purchase at your own risk, though - as USB failures seem to be a common ACER problem.
I've had this laptop for almost two years and the main problem I have with it. Is it over heating and it doesnt stay charged long.

The CPU isn't the best it could be for the money, the gpu is a 3050 which reviews are saying this mobile version is inferior to the old RX 580 from AMD, which means it's not very good at all and only has 4gb of vram, the amount of RAM and storage is also low. But they give you a 144htz screen. It does not make sense and for the money you could get better. If you want to game a 3060 should be the least you accept, since the 3050 is quite poor outside of old games or very low spec modern ones.It's rather overpriced to me and I'm not impressed with the cost cutting they did.
Acer produces cheapest computers. The low price comes from cheap chips. Still worth to buy if want to save money.

reviewTitle: After a panic attack and some deep research
reviewDescription: I thought it was dead on arrival, but you have to really pay attention to how you plug it the port in the back. There is an extra pin that clicks when you push a little harder. I learned this after a mild panic attack and much research.As a single mom I bought this laptop on Black Friday. With working in retail I didn’t have a chance to open it and charge it/load it with all the cool things from Steam before Christmas Eve when I was about to wrap it - saying I had to work but secretly went to a friends house to wrap gifts. When plugging it in, the charge light didn’t light up. I must have unplugged/tested the outlets a million times, crying because all my son wanted for christmas was a gaming laptop.After some googling I found a forum talking about this. Glad I did. I’ll update and see how it actually performs once my son starts gaming on it.What a heart attack for no reason. It should really specify this, because when you just plug it in there is a click before you have to push harder, for another click to charge.

Deja mucho que desear de mi parte, ya que Fortnite de 60 fps en medios no sube más y da tirones hasta los 28 fps, juegos de bajo rendimiento como L4D2, BF4, y por ese estilo están super bien, pero los de última generación ni de broma los corre, cabe aclarar que le subí la ram a 32GB y le compré un M.2 y ni así, aunque actualices drivers no da para más el equipo

I bought this laptop for my dad as I have the same one but mine has 16Gb of ram while this one only has 8Gb. I can definitely tell the difference. This one is a lot slower doing just routine things like setting it up and downloading the usual programs such as office and Adobe. It may look just like mine but it's definitely not as responsive, however it will do for what my dad needs it for. If you're a gamer you definitely don't want this. If you want a fast and responsive device that will last you fir years, this also isn't the device for you. If you want something to just check your email and the weather daily then this will do the trick.
Received a defective laptop. The screen had some lighting issues. S

reviewTitle: Buena pero la pantalla es pequeña.
reviewDescription: No me gustó la pantalla, es pequeña creo más de lo q dice el producto
Their BIOS is about as locked down as I have ever seen one, many options simply missing.  COntacting support it seems they don't really care.

reviewTitle: Not even close to my previous laptop
reviewDescription: I replaced my aging Acer laptop with this 'comparable' model only to find out it is NOT COMPARABLE AT ALL. I had driver issues right out of the gate and still can't get the sound to work consistently. I am frustrated beyond at the several steps down I've taken with this purchase. NOT HAPPY. (One week after my initial review, my opinion has only gotten worse. This laptop will not stay connected to my Bluetooth devices and the sound still is not working properly, although I have gone through all the trouble shooting I've not found a solution. I am going to take that old laptop in to have it gone over and put this $800 paperweight on the shelf.)

I had this laptop for a year and 9 months, and it worked very well, until it randomly shut off and refused to turn back on ! I tried customer support on the acer website and found no solution, and they have been unreachable since it is out of warranty. A laptop under 2 years old, taken care of, treated gently, and yet ! The support chat option has not worked, and when I send any emails to their support email they bounce back and tell me this email does not exist !! I’m extremely frustrated with this.

The laptop itself is good, processing power is acceptable. Backlit keyboard, big track pad, light weight, bright screen.The bad--The laptop has a very short battery life (the price of the laptop being light). The mouse track pad left mouse clicks too easily (while moving the cursor, its too easy to inadvertently click the track pad with the problems that comes with that).At the price point, it's not a slam dunk, but not horrible.

The product is a solid all around gamer, great for a modern pick up. BUT! It needs a ram upgrade and it needs more storage. I put in a 1tb ssd. However, the product I received was clearly defective, it wouldn't let me do the windows start up, and even now that I swapped the ssds and installed win 11 manually. If the screen shuts off or the lid is closed my computer blue screens. So buyers beware, some driver issues already, otherwise it's a great budget laptop and easy to upgrade.

I've had this for over a year now and it works alright, only issues is it does tend to crash every once in a while, more frequent when gaming, and honestly can't leave it unplugged from the charger for very long
This was a perfect gift for my teen son. However 2 years and a month later and the motherboard is fried and nothing they can do at this time.
My only complaint,  which is a huge one for me,  is the battery life is horrible!

reviewTitle: Crashed right out of the box - very hard to complete setup
reviewDescription: I know it's a cheap PC, but really - it should be able to complete setup without crashing. It kept freezing forcing me to hard reboot, and then it kept dropping the Internet connection, even though I'm 4 feet from the router. All other devices are working fine.No manual at all - no way to get help that's apparent.

reviewTitle: Worked great for a year, however overheats pretty fast
reviewDescription: Unfortunately the GPU burnt out and causing the PC to crash often, looking for a replacement. It’s a laptop so you get what you paid for, just be very careful.

Main issue is screen display all the way turned down while playing a card game, I’m lucky if the battery even lasts two hours! Disappointed about battery life mainly! Sucks having it plugged in all the time!

reviewTitle: Just got mine today BUT for some reason it won’t turn on or charge while plugged in. HELP anyone
reviewDescription: I don’t know what could be possibly wrong with it or if I’m not doing something right . I just opened up this new laptop out of the box and it won’t turn on nor will it charge . Can anyone help me please ?
Several keys on the keyboard have fallen off and even after trying to reconnect them they come loose.  Got tired of them not staying put and started using a wireless keyboard.
Great besides the battery barely lasts maybe 2 hours just browsing on the internet. Very dissapointing. Great otherwise.

I received the laptop and couldn’t figure out why it wasn’t charging.  Read a lot of reviews to see what the problem was and after 20 minutes I just pushed the charger into port harder until it clicked a second time.

reviewTitle: Thought it was DOA but it is not
reviewDescription: So on Christmas morning I thought it was DOA. However, you really have to push in the power cord into the back of it computer. There is a noticeable click. If you do not hear the click then it will not charge.
I needed a touchscreen and a ten key. I had to return it because it didn't have a touchscreen. It's important for multitasking while gaming at the same time.

Frames will be locked at 60 automatically, you have to change the settings yourself. The laptop can barely run a small game without issues, I’m kind of disappointed. I use this “gaming laptop” for everything besides gaming now.
Couldn’t handle beamng on steam for very long before I had a gpu crash. Not clear if memory is expandable
currently charging, nearly had a heart attack after an hour of it not lighting up or turning on.

Ordered this computer for my son's birthday. It would not turn on despite having it plugged into the wall and confirming everything was set up properly. I reached out to the seller and did not receive a reply. I went to return the item and I'm being forced to pay for shipping??? On a defective item?! On an item that was meant to be a birthday present for a child and they opened it, set it up and it did not work? And you also expect me to pay a restocking fee - for a laptop that doesn't work? This seller is engaged in preditory behavior and I demand my money back. I'm happy to return the computer but I will not pay for shipping for a defective computer and I certainly won't be charged a restock fee for a computer that is TRASH and doesn't work.

reviewTitle: Keyboard might have some keys not work and Acer support is horrible.
reviewDescription: I decided to buy this laptop to work and play games while I traveled it arrived today when I started it up I noticed that multiple keys were not registering when pressed. Calling Acer support I was told that this is a hardware issue and I would have to send it back to them for them to fix it and it would take 10-12 business days when I leave in 8 I was then told that they wouldn't be able to mail it back to me if I was in another country so I would have to have it delivered to a family members house and then pay for international shipping and that was the best they can do. despite them shipping a defective device they make it seem like them fixing it for free is something I should be thanking them for when it's the bare minimum they can do overall a horrible experience.
Amazon recommended this with a monitor it usn't compatible with. I wasted three hours and more dollars following instructions from Acer support. Stay away from this.

If you want a gaming laptop, this is not the droid you seek.  i have 1 (one) game installed.  it will not run it.  constant errors, failures, crashes.  Ive dedicated an entire day to making this single game run on this pc and it will not do it.  I even had my brother come over who is an AVID pc gamer come over to try and fix it, still the same issues, and he has a bachelors degree in computer science.  It literally does not have the hardware to play even one game.  DO NOT BUY THIS PC.  Do yourself a favor and find something better.  I can not, NOT recommend this purchase enough.  This is absolute garbage.  Don't waste your time, effort, energy or money like i did.  Go get an actual gaming PC.  I don't even trust this enough to write this review.  Hope you see this.  Sincerely, Disappointed

reviewTitle: Broke for no reason. DO NOT BUY
reviewDescription: Almost a thousand dollars for a laptop that just breaks for no reason. Had it on one night playing YouTube and when I woke up it just stopped working out of no where and the power button wouldn’t working. I do not recommend this model or BRAND unless you want your laptop to break after just 3 months.

I've never had to leave a negative review however I had complications with the laptop. The laptop would constantly freeze making it unresponsive therefore the laptop was not useful and I had to send the laptop back. After returning the laptop, with my warranty I was able to receive the laptop back but unfortunately their were still errors with the laptop crashing and freezing. After doing my own personal research I found out that the wrong bios were installed. By then My warranty was up so there was nothing that could be done without paying out of pocket for repairs. Moving forward I will not be shopping with this company!
The battery damage at 2 weeks :(

reviewTitle: Didn't turn on. Delivered in a loose oversized box.
reviewDescription: Laptop did not turn on or recognize power source when plugged in. Looks like a nice expensive paperweight.  The laptop was received in a large cardboard Box commaxe come up about twice the size of the product Box. Possibly damaged during delivery because there was plenty of space to bounce around. After looking at reviews it seems that this power issue is a common issue for this laptop.Decided to purchase this laptop after my original pick was lost during delivery for almost a week and Amazon wanted me to pay an extra $100 after the price went up. Customer service was not accommodating in the least.  The whole ordeal has been a major frustration and waste of time. Will not be purchasing any big ticket items or electronics from Amazon again.
Laptop will overheat over a 20+ year old game. I was playing World of warcraft one night, and BAM, laptop turned off and died. Never to be revived again. Spend your money elsewhere.

days after getting laptop and playing Warcraft, hardware became corrupted and laptop was completely FUBAR. Read mixed reviews, a lot were good but a lot were bad. Not to knock the computer completely I’m sure the ones that aren’t lemons are great, but the odds of you receiving a lemon may be higher with this particular laptop. The bells and whistles of aesthetics are cool but there’s no point in having a cool looking laptop if you’re only going to get a week of use out of it. Spend your money elsewhere
